What to see: Movies opening Christmas week

9:08 a.m. EST December 22, 2014

Planning to see some movies with family and friends over the holiday weekend? Watch out for these turkeys, whether in the theater or on DVD.(Photo: Illustration by Kevin A. Kepple, USA TODAY)

5 CONNECT 7 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Looking for a good movie over the Christmas holiday? Here are the latest releases, trailers and reviews.

'The Gambler'

Playing a college professor addicted to losing, Mark Wahlberg takes on his most ambitious acting job ever in "The Gambler," a gritty remake of a 1974 film that starred James Caan. And the new gambler doesn't embarrass himself. (Rating: 2.5 stars out of 4) Read the review and get movie times

Mark Wahlberg stars as a college professor by day and gambler by night in 'The Gambler.' His rising debt forces him to borrow money from his mother and a loan shark.

'Into the Woods'

The Stephen Sondheim fairy-tale musical that sent up every contrivance and cliche that The Brothers Grimm could cook up, earns a lush, grand and star-studded production for the big screen. (Rating: 2.5 stars out of 4) Read the review and get movie times

Meryl Streep plays a witch who tasks a childless baker and his wife with gathering magical items from classic fairy tales to reverse a curse put on their family tree in 'Into the Woods.'

'Unbroken'

Angelina Jolie's film of Laura "Seabiscuit" Hillenbrand's book about ex-Olympian Louis Zamperini's true life survivor story, stumbles into most every movie of the genre in ways that suggest she hasn't figured out how these things work. (Rating: 2 stars out of 4) Read the review and get movie times


'Unbroken' is based on the true story of Olympic athlete Louis Zamperini who survived a near-fatal plane crash in WWII only to be caught by the Japanese navy and sent to a prisoner-of-war camp.
